title: Why did Riot ban Gleeb's smurf but not his main?
body:
http://puu.sh/nD8Dz/2621285a8e.jpg

Wouldn't they consider that ban evasion? Oh I forgot. The rules don't apply if you are a former pro or famous. I eagerly await your pathetic attempts to justify their actions.

You know if this was anyone else they would have banned both accounts but look. He's free to be toxic on his main or a different smurf. Players who should be setting the example get special privileges . As much as they brag about holding everyone at the same level of accountability they only do so when it fits their agenda.

Classy. 

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

replies.body:
Weebglarbu is not related to Gleebglarbu. The picture and discussion on General Discussion is falsified content. 

Being on GD, we decided as the moderation team to not take action on it. We will be closing this discussion here as this holds no value, is untrue, and purpose is to stir drama.
They very very very rarely ban "players", they ban accounts. Unless they explicitly tell a player they are no longer allowed to use alternate accounts, they can do so.

> [{quoted}](name=Deep Terror Nami,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=LZ4AVgb5,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-03-11T23:36:41.789+0000)
>
> They very very very rarely ban "players", they ban accounts. Unless they explicitly tell a player they are no longer allowed to use alternate accounts, they can do so.

It's not that they choose not ban the average player, it's because THEY CAN'T. That would require an IP ban which they refuse to do for obvious reasons. However this is a prominent figure in the scene. What's the point of banning if it doesn't do anything? They know WHO it is and they have the option to do it but they won't. Now if it was a random player they can't do anything about that for the reasons stated above. Your logic is full of holes.

**Do you honestly think that means much to ban a (ex) pro's smurf account that has almost nothing on it?** This might as well not even be a punishment. He most likely has multiple smurfs AND his main account. He will continue to be toxic and Riot will continue to turn a blind eye. Nothing new here.

 Defender of GD? More like Defender of Riot.
That's a great strawman argument you have constructed there. Maybe you should use it on someone that actually mentioned what you're talking about?

> [{quoted}](name=Deep Terror Nami,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=LZ4AVgb5,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-11T23:50:42.545+0000)
>
> That's a great strawman argument you have constructed there. Maybe you should use it on someone that actually mentioned what you're talking about?

Nice ad hominem rebuttal. My point still stands and you have ignored it because you know deep inside the truth of my words. This player was toxic, got a perma-ban on his smurf and probably didn't even bat an eye. Here you are condoning toxicity with a circle-jerk claim. Sounds like DTN.

Perhaps you should try and address what I said instead of attacking my character? I might take you seriously. Until then you're not impressing anyone except your local fanboys.
Again, I have not commented on what you brought up, so I could not possibly be attacking you or rebutting your point, therefore no ad hominem.

Oh but I think you did. From your quote I can infer that Riot deals with these on a case by case basis and rarely bans **players**. So basically you're saying Riot COULD have but CHOSE not to. I never argued this point I was pointing out the bias of Riots decision in my original post. Tou didn't even address it and instead ignored my claim and instead attacked my character.

> That's a great strawman argument you have constructed there. Maybe you should use it on someone that actually mentioned what you're talking about?

While offering nothing conducive to the conversation. This is why I rarely post on this sub-section because it's chock full of circle-jerk fanboys who don't say anything but up-vote their local hero and down-vote whoever they are arguing with regardless of how toxic/foolish their "hero" sound.
